org.apache.taverna.server.master

Class TavernaServer

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.apache.taverna.server.master.TavernaServer
  • All Implemented Interfaces:
    TavernaServerBean, UriBuilderFactory, TavernaServerREST, TavernaServerSOAP

    @Path(value="/")
 @DeclareRoles(value={"ROLE_tavernauser","ROLE_tavernasuperuser"})
 @WSDLDocumentation(value="An instance of Taverna 3.1.0 Server.")
public abstract class TavernaServer
extends Object
implements TavernaServerSOAP, TavernaServerREST, TavernaServerBean
    The core implementation of the web application.
    Author:
    Donal Fellows

      • destroyRun

        @InvocationCounter.CallCounted
 @CallTimeLogger.PerfLogged
 @RolesAllowed(value="ROLE_tavernauser")
public void destroyRun(String runName)
                                                                                                                    throws UnknownRunException,
                                                                                                                           NoUpdateException
        Description copied from interface: TavernaServerSOAP
        Destroy a run immediately. This might or might not actually relinquish resources; that's up to the service implementation and deployment.
        Specified by:
        destroyRun in interface TavernaServerSOAP
        Parameters:
        runName - The handle of the run.
        Throws:
        UnknownRunException - If the server doesn't know about the run or if the user is not permitted to see it.
        NoUpdateException - If the user isn't allowed to manipulate the lifetime of the run.

        getRunExpiry in interface TavernaServerSOAP
        Parameters:
        runName - The handle of the run.
        Returns:
        A date at which the expiry will be scheduled. The actual deletion will happen an arbitrary amount of time later (depending on system policy).
        Throws:
        UnknownRunException - If the server doesn't know about the run or if the user is not permitted to see it.

        Set the status of a run. This is used to start it executing, make it stop executing, etc. Note that changing the status of a run can never cause the run to be destroyed.

        setRunStatus in interface TavernaServerSOAP

      • setRunCredential

        @InvocationCounter.CallCounted
 @CallTimeLogger.PerfLogged
 @RolesAllowed(value="ROLE_tavernauser")
public String setRunCredential(String runName,
                                                                                                                                   String credentialID,
                                                                                                                                   Credential credential)
                                                                                                                            throws UnknownRunException,
                                                                                                                                   NotOwnerException,
                                                                                                                                   InvalidCredentialException,
                                                                                                                                   NoCredentialException,
                                                                                                                                   BadStateChangeException
        Description copied from interface: TavernaServerSOAP
        Set a credential associated with the run.
        Specified by:
        setRunCredential in interface TavernaServerSOAP
        Parameters:
        runName - The handle of the run.
        credentialID - The handle of the credential to set. If empty, a new credential will be created.
        credential - The credential to set.
        Returns:
        The handle of the credential that was created or updated.
        Throws:
        UnknownRunException - If the server doesn't know about the run or if the user is not permitted to see it.
        NotOwnerException - If the user is permitted to see the run, but isn't the owner; only the owner may manipulate the credentials.
        InvalidCredentialException - If the credential fails its checks.
        NoCredentialException - If the credentialID is not empty but does not correspond to an existing credential.
        BadStateChangeException - If an attempt to manipulate the credentials is done after the workflow has started running.

      • makeRunDirectory

        @InvocationCounter.CallCounted
 @CallTimeLogger.PerfLogged
 @RolesAllowed(value="ROLE_tavernauser")
public DirEntry makeRunDirectory(String runName,
                                                                                                                                     DirEntry parent,
                                                                                                                                     String name)
                                                                                                                              throws UnknownRunException,
                                                                                                                                     NoUpdateException,
                                                                                                                                     FilesystemAccessException,
                                                                                                                                     NoDirectoryEntryException
        Description copied from interface: TavernaServerSOAP
        Make a new empty directory beneath an existing one, which must be the run's working directory or a directory beneath it. Runs do not share working directories.
        Specified by:
        makeRunDirectory in interface TavernaServerSOAP
        Parameters:
        runName - The handle of the run.
        parent - The parent directory that will have the new directory added beneath it.
        name - The name of the directory to create. Must not be the same as any other file or directory in the parent directory. The name must not consist of .. or have a / in it.
        Returns:
        A reference to the created directory.
        Throws:
        UnknownRunException - If the server doesn't know about the run or if the user is not permitted to see it.
        NoUpdateException - If the user is not allowed to make modifications to the run.
        FilesystemAccessException - If some assumption is violated (e.g., making something with the same name as something that already exists).
        NoDirectoryEntryException - If the name of the containing directory can't be looked up.

        d - Reference to an existing item in a directory that will be destroyed. May be a reference to either a file or a directory.
        Throws:
        UnknownRunException - If the server doesn't know about the run or if the user is not permitted to see it.
        NoUpdateException - If the user is not allowed to make modifications to the run.
        FilesystemAccessException - If some assumption is violated (e.g., deleting something which doesn't exist or attempting to delete the main working directory).
        NoDirectoryEntryException - If the name of the file or directory can't be looked up.

      • getRunFileContents

        @InvocationCounter.CallCounted
 @CallTimeLogger.PerfLogged
 @RolesAllowed(value="ROLE_tavernauser")
public byte[] getRunFileContents(String runName,
                                                                                                                                     DirEntry d)

                                                                                                                                     FilesystemAccessException,
                                                                                                                                     NoDirectoryEntryException
        Description copied from interface: TavernaServerSOAP
        Get the contents of a file under the run's working directory. Runs do not share working directories.
        Specified by:
        getRunFileContents in interface TavernaServerSOAP
        Parameters:
        runName - The handle of the run.
        d - The name of the file to fetch; the main working directory is / and .. is always disallowed.

        The literal byte contents of the file.

                                                                                                                                 String configuration)

                                                                                                                                 NoUpdateException,
                                                                                                                                 NoListenerException
        Description copied from interface: TavernaServerSOAP
        Adds an event listener to the run.
        Specified by:
        addRunListener in interface TavernaServerSOAP
        Parameters:
        runName - The handle of the run.
        listenerType - The type of event listener to add. Must be one of the names returned by the TavernaServerSOAP.getServerListeners() operation.

        The actual name of the listener.

        UnknownRunException - If the server doesn't know about the run or if the user is not permitted to see it.
        NoUpdateException - If the user isn't allowed to manipulate the run.
        NoListenerException - If the listener construction fails (e.g., due to an unsupported listenerType or a problem with the configuration).

        @InvocationCounter.CallCounted
 @CallTimeLogger.PerfLogged
 @RolesAllowed(value="ROLE_tavernauser")
public void setRunInputPortListDelimiter(String runName,
                                                                                                                                             String portName,
                                                                                                                                             String delimiter)
                                                                                                                                      throws UnknownRunException,
                                                                                                                                             NoUpdateException,
                                                                                                                                             BadStateChangeException,
                                                                                                                                             BadPropertyValueException
        Description copied from interface: TavernaServerSOAP
        Tells the given run to use the given list delimiter (a single-character string value) for splitting the input on the given port. Note that nullability of the delimiter is supported here.
        Specified by:
        setRunInputPortListDelimiter in interface TavernaServerSOAP
        Parameters:
        runName - The handle of the run.
        portName - The port to set the list delimiter for.

        NoUpdateException - If the user isn't allowed to manipulate the run.
        BadStateChangeException - If the run is not in the Initialized state.
        BadPropertyValueException - If the delimiter may not be changed to the given literal value.
